00001 /* File parse_amber_prmtop.c begun on 20080610 by BLFoley
00002  * Purpose: parse entries from prmtop file (already read in) into
00003  *      appropriate data locations within an assembly
00004  *      Also adds the prmtop P to the assembly's void pointer
00005  */
00006 #include "AMBER/amber_prmtop.h"
00007 
00008 assembly parse_amber_prmtop(amber_prmtop *P){
00009 assembly A;
00010 int *ICO,nICO;
00011 int pa=0,pb=0,pc=0,pd=0,pA1=0,pA2=0,pA3,pA4,pI1=0;
00012 int NextRes=0,nummol=0,*resi; // more utility integers
00013 int sa=0,sr=0,sm=0,ta=0,tr=0,tm=0;
00014 int IPTRES=0,NSPM=0,NSPSOL=0,*NSP; // solvent/solute info & #atoms per molecule
00015 molbond *MB,*MBTMP;
00016 angle_index *MANG;
00017 torsion_index *MTOR;
00018 molindex *MOLI,*MOLBNDI; // MOLI for here, MOLBNDI for assigning molecules
00019 char **ATNAME,**TREECLASS,*RADTYPE,tmp[80];
00020 double *R,*SC,*MASS; // radii and screening constants for IS, atom masses
00021 fileset F;
00022 //amber_prmtop *aprm;
00023 
00025 A.nVP=1; 
00026 A.VP=P;
00027 
00028 // do some initializations
00029 A.nPRM=1;
00030 A.PRM=(parameter_set*)calloc(1,sizeof(parameter_set));
00031 
00032 // First, find the pointers and read them into the top structure
00033 // Also add them to the assembly, as needed
00034 // Any that are not added now can be added later -- chances are that 
00035 //      no one had a use for them previously.  In any case, they will
00036 //      be present as-is in the void pointer
00037 for(pa=0;pa<P[0].nS;pa++){ // get pointers first...
00038         if(strcmp(P[0].SN[pa],"POINTERS")==0){ 
00039                 // total number of atoms
00040                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[0],"%d",&P[0].NATOM); 
00041                 A.na = P[0].NATOM; 
00042                 if(A.na>0){
00043                         A.a=(atom**)calloc(A.na,sizeof(atom*));
00044                         MOLI=(molindex*)calloc(A.na,sizeof(molindex)); // to keep up with locations per atom
00045                         } 
00046                 for(pb=0;pb<A.na;pb++){A.a[pb]=(atom*)calloc(1,sizeof(atom));}
00047                 // number of atom types
00048                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[1],"%d",&P[0].NTYPES); 
00049                 A.PRM[0].nAT=P[0].NTYPES; 
00050                 if(A.PRM[0].nAT>0){
00051                         A.PRM[0].AT=(atype*)calloc(A.PRM[0].nAT,sizeof(atype));
00052                         A.PRM[0].nNBT=A.PRM[0].nAT*(A.PRM[0].nAT+1)/2;
00053                         A.PRM[0].NBT=(bond_type*)calloc(A.PRM[0].nNBT,sizeof(bond_type));
00054                         nICO=A.PRM[0].nAT*A.PRM[0].nAT;
00055                         ICO=(int*)calloc(nICO,sizeof(int));
00056                         } 
00057                 // Numbers of actual bonds, angles, dihedrals
00058                 // NOT adding these number-of distinctions to the assembly
00059                 // Instead, adding them all as plain bonds, etc. (see "D" description for distinction)
00060                 // See also NBONA, etc., below (constraints)...
00061                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[2],"%d",&P[0].NBONH); // number of bonds containing hydrogen
00062                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[3],"%d",&P[0].MBONA); // number of bonds not containing hydrogen
00063                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[4],"%d",&P[0].NTHETH); // number of angles containing hydrogen
00064                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[5],"%d",&P[0].MTHETA); // number of angles not containing hydrogen
00065                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[6],"%d",&P[0].NPHIH); // number of dihedrals containing hydrogen
00066                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[7],"%d",&P[0].MPHIA); // number of dihedrals not containing hydrogen
00067                 // Unused parameters and the excluded atoms list (probably not used in glycam)
00068                 // NOT adding these at all
00069                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[8],"%d",&P[0].NHPARM); // currently not used
00070                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[9],"%d",&P[0].NPARM); // currently not used
00071                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[10],"%d",&P[0].NEXT); // number of excluded atoms
00072                 // Number of residues
00073                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[11],"%d",&P[0].NRES); 
00074                 A.nr = P[0].NRES; 
00075                 if(A.nr>0){A.r=(residue**)calloc(A.nr,sizeof(residue*));} // will move these later 
00076                 for(pb=0;pb<A.nr;pb++){A.r[pb]=(residue*)calloc(1,sizeof(residue));}
00077                 // The rest of the bonds, angles and torsions (constraints)
00078                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[12],"%d",&P[0].NBONA); // MBONA + number of constraint bonds
00079                 A.nb = P[0].NBONH + P[0].NBONA; // all the bonds
00080                 if(A.nb>0){A.b=(molbond*)calloc(A.nb,sizeof(molbond));}
00081                 if(A.nb>0){MB=(molbond*)calloc(A.nb,sizeof(molbond));}
00082                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[13],"%d",&P[0].NTHETA); // MTHETA + number of constraint angles
00083                 A.nANG=P[0].NTHETH+P[0].NTHETA; // all the angles
00084                 if(A.nANG>0){A.ANG=(angle_index*)calloc(A.nANG,sizeof(angle_index));}
00085                 if(A.nANG>0){MANG=(angle_index*)calloc(A.nANG,sizeof(angle_index));}
00086                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[14],"%d",&P[0].NPHIA); // MPHIA + number of constraint dihedrals
00087                 A.nTOR=P[0].NPHIH+P[0].NPHIA; // all the torsions
00088                 if(A.nTOR>0){A.TOR=(torsion_index*)calloc(A.nTOR,sizeof(torsion_index));}
00089                 if(A.nTOR>0){MTOR=(torsion_index*)calloc(A.nTOR,sizeof(torsion_index));}
00090                 // Numbers of bond, angle and torsion types
00091                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[15],"%d",&P[0].NUMBND); // number of unique bond types
00092                 A.PRM[0].nBT = P[0].NUMBND; // number of unique bond types
00093                 if(A.PRM[0].nBT>0){A.PRM[0].BT=(bond_type*)calloc(A.PRM[0].nBT,sizeof(bond_type));}
00094                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[16],"%d",&P[0].NUMANG); // number of unique angle types
00095                 A.PRM[0].nANT = P[0].NUMANG; // number of unique angle types
00096                 if(A.PRM[0].nANT>0){A.PRM[0].ANT=(angle_type*)calloc(A.PRM[0].nANT,sizeof(angle_type));}
00097                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[17],"%d",&P[0].NPTRA); // number of unique dihedral types
00098                 A.PRM[0].nTRT = P[0].NPTRA; // number of unique dihedral types
00099                 if(A.PRM[0].nTRT>0){A.PRM[0].TRT=(torsion_type*)calloc(A.PRM[0].nTRT,sizeof(torsion_type));}
00100                 // Number of atom types in parameter file
00101                 // NOT adding this at all at present
00102                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[18],"%d",&P[0].NATYP); // number of atom types in parameter file, see SOLTY below
00103                 // Number of Lennard-Jones 10-12 H-Bond pair types
00104                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[19],"%d",&P[0].NPHB); // number of distinct 10-12 hydrogen bond pair types
00105                 A.PRM[0].nHBT = P[0].NPHB;
00106                 if(A.PRM[0].nHBT>0){A.PRM[0].HBT=(bond_type*)calloc(A.PRM[0].nHBT,sizeof(bond_type));}
00107                 // Perturbation information
00108                 // NOT adding these at all (no longer used as of AMBER 10)
00109                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[20],"%d",&P[0].IFPERT); // set to 1 if perturbation info is to be read in
00110                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[21],"%d",&P[0].NBPER); // number of bonds to be perturbed
00111                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[22],"%d",&P[0].NGPER); // number of angles to be perturbed
00112                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[23],"%d",&P[0].NDPER); // number of dihedrals to be perturbed
00113                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[24],"%d",&P[0].MBPER); // number of bonds with atoms completely in perturbed group
00114                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[25],"%d",&P[0].MGPER); // number of angles with atoms completely in perturbed group
00115                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[26],"%d",&P[0].MDPER); // number of dihedrals with atoms completely in perturbed groups
00116                 // Box information
00117                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[27],"%d",&P[0].IFBOX); // set to 1 if standard periodic box, 2 when truncated octahedral
00118                 if(P[0].IFBOX==0){A.nBOX=0;} 
00119                 else{
00120                         A.nBOX=1;
00121                         A.BOX=(boxinfo*)calloc(A.nBOX,sizeof(boxinfo));
00122                         A.BOX[0].nC=A.BOX[0].nCD=2; 
00123                         A.BOX[0].C=(coord_nD*)calloc(A.BOX[0].nC,sizeof(coord_nD));
00124                         A.BOX[0].CD=(char**)calloc(A.BOX[0].nCD,sizeof(char*));
00125                         A.BOX[0].CD[0]=strdup("Periodic box, angle between the XY and YZ planes in degrees.");
00126                         A.BOX[0].C[0].nD=1; 
00127                         A.BOX[0].C[0].D=(double*)calloc(A.BOX[0].C[0].nD,sizeof(double));
00128                         A.BOX[0].CD[1]=strdup("The periodic box lengths in the X, Y, and Z directions");
00129                         A.BOX[0].C[1].nD=3; 
00130                         A.BOX[0].C[1].D=(double*)calloc(A.BOX[0].C[1].nD,sizeof(double));
00131                         A.BOX[0].STYPE=strdup("standard periodic");
00132                         if(P[0].IFBOX==1){A.BOX[0].GTYPE=strdup("rectangular");}
00133                         if(P[0].IFBOX==2){A.BOX[0].GTYPE=strdup("truncated octahedral");}
00134                         if(P[0].IFBOX>2){A.BOX[0].GTYPE=strdup("unknown box type");} 
00135                         }
00136                 //if(P[0].IFBOX==0){A.boxtype=strdup("none");}   // changed to new box_info type by BLF on 20080813
00137                 //if(P[0].IFBOX==1){A.boxtype=strdup("standard periodic");}
00138                 //if(P[0].IFBOX==2){A.boxtype=strdup("truncated octahedral");}
00139                 //if(P[0].IFBOX>2){A.boxtype=strdup("unknown box type");}
00140 
00141                 // NOT adding these at all 
00142                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[28],"%d",&P[0].NMXRS); // number of atoms in the largest residue
00143                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[29],"%d",&P[0].IFCAP); // set to 1 if the CAP option from edit was specified
00144                 //
00145                 break; // no need to keep scanning...
00146                 }
00147         }
00148 
00149 for(pa=0;pa<P[0].nS;pa++){// Loop through each of the sections
00150         P[0].S[pa].is_standard = 1; // Set is_standard to one as default
00151         //      check against each standard section
00152         //      if there is a match:
00153         //              set is_standard to zero
00154         //              record to assembly as needed
00155         //
00156 
00157 //FORMAT(20a4)  (ITITL(i), i=1,20)
00158 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"TITLE")==0){ // place in the Assembly description
00159         P[0].ITITL = pa; // the title section 
00160         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00161         // copy the title into the assembly's description
00162         A.D=(char*)calloc(P[0].S[pa].nt*P[0].S[pa].nc+1,sizeof(char));
00163         for(pb=0;pb<P[0].S[pa].nt;pb++){strcat(A.D,P[0].S[pa].D[pb]);}
00164 }
00165 //FORMAT(12i6) 
00166 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"POINTERS")==0){ // these are already added
00167         P[0].POINTERS=pa; // pointer to the section containing the original char-strings
00168         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00169 }
00170 // FORMAT(20a4)  (IGRAPH(i), i=1,NATOM)
00171 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"ATOM_NAME")==0){ // these eventually go into the molecules/residues/etc
00172         P[0].IGRAPH=pa; // IGRAPH : the user atoms names 
00173         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00174         // for now, add these to the straight list of Assembly atoms
00175 //printf("P[0].S[pa].nt=%d, A.na is %d\n",P[0].S[pa].nt,A.na);
00176         if(P[0].S[pa].nt!=A.na){mywhine("P[0].S[pa].nt!=A.na in ATOM_NAME in parse_amber_prmtop");}
00177         for(pb=0;pb<A.na;pb++){
00178                 //A.a[pb][0].N=(char*)calloc((P[0].S[pa].nc+1),sizeof(char));
00179 //printf("P[0].S[%d].D[%d] is ",pa,pb);
00180 //printf(">>>%s<<<\n",P[0].S[pa].D[pb]);

00182                 A.a[pb][0].N=(char*)calloc((strlen(tmp)+1),sizeof(char));
00183                 strcpy(A.a[pb][0].N,tmp);
00184                 //sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[pb],"%s",A.a[pb][0].N);
00185 //printf("P[0].S[pa].D[pb] is >>>%s<<< and A.a[pb][0].N is >>>%s<<< (strlen %d)\t",P[0].S[pa].D[pb],A.a[pb][0].N,strlen(A.a[pb][0].N));
00186                 //A.a[pb][0].N=(char*)realloc(A.a[pb][0].N,strlen(A.a[pb][0].N+1));

00188

00190 }
00191 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  (CHRG(i), i=1,NATOM)
00192 // (Divide by 18.2223 to convert to charge in units of the electron charge) 
00193 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"CHARGE")==0){ // these go with each atom
00194         P[0].CHRG   =pa; // CHRG   : the atom charges.  
00195         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00196         if(P[0].S[pa].nt!=A.na){mywhine("P[0].S[pa].nt!=A.na in CHARGE in parse_amber_prmtop");}
00197         for(pb=0;pb<A.na;pb++){
00198                 A.a[pb][0].nch=1;
00199                 A.a[pb][0].ch=(double*)calloc(1,sizeof(double));
00200                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[pb],"%lf",&A.a[pb][0].ch[0]);
00201                 A.a[pb][0].ch[0]/=18.2223;
00202                 }
00203 }
00204 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  (AMASS(i), i=1,NATOM)
00205 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"MASS")==0){ // with each atom

00210         for(pb=0;pb<A.na;pb++){sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[pb],"%lf",&MASS[pb]);}
00211         //for(pb=0;pb<A.na;pb++){sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[pb],"%lf",&A.a[pb][0].m);}

00217         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section

00221                 A.a[pb][0].t--;
00222                 if(A.a[pb][0].t<0){mywhine("A.a[pb][0].t<0 in parse_amber_prmtop");}

00239         for(pb=0;pb<nICO;pb++){sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[pb],"%d",&ICO[pb]);}
00240                 // arrays CN1, CN2 and ASOL, BSOL.  All possible 6-12
00241                 // or 10-12 atoms type interactions are represented.
00242                 // NOTE: A particular atom type can have either a 10-12
00243                 // or a 6-12 interaction, but not both.  The index is
00244                 // calculated as follows:
00245                 // index = ICO(NTYPES*(IAC(i)-1)+IAC(j))
00246                 // If index is positive, this is an index into the
00247                 // 6-12 parameter arrays (CN1 and CN2) otherwise it
00248                 // is an index into the 10-12 parameter arrays (ASOL and BSOL).

00294                         MOLI[pc].m=-1; // we don't know this yet
00295                         MOLI[pc].r=pb; // check this later
00296                         MOLI[pc].a=pd; // check this later

00299                         }

00301 //printf("pb is %d\n",pb);

00313                         //A.r[pb][0].a[NextRes-pc]=A.a[pc][0]; // copy atom into residue
00314                         //free(A.a[pc]); // free that memory
00315 //printf("\t***the name of new atom pc is >>>%s<<<\n",A.r[pb][0].a[pd].N);
00316 //printf("\t***the charge of new atom pc is >>>%f<<<\n",A.r[pb][0].a[pd].ch[0]);
00317 //printf("xxxx the name of atom pc is >>>%s<<<\n",A.a[pc][0].N);
00318                         A.a[pc]=&A.r[pb][0].a[pd]; // set atom pointer to new location
00319                         //A.a[pc]=&A.r[pb][0].a[NextRes-pc]; // set atom pointer to new location
00320                         A.a[pc][0].n=pc+1; // set the amber original number
00321                         MOLI[pc].i=pc; // set absolute atom number in array terms
00322                         MOLI[pc].m=-1; // we don't know this yet
00323                         MOLI[pc].r=pb; // check this later
00324                         MOLI[pc].a=pd; // check this later
00325                         //MOLI[pc].a=NextRes-pc; // check this later
00326                         pd++;
00327                         }
00328 
00329         
00330 }
00331                 // IPRES(i) to IPRES(i+1)-1 
00332 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  (RK(i), i=1,NUMBND)
00333 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"BOND_FORCE_CONSTANT")==0){ // 
00334         P[0].RK     =pa; // RK     : force constant for the bonds of each type, kcal/mol 
00335         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00336 //printf("pa is %d; this is BOND_FORCE_CONSTANT\n",pa);
00337 //printf("the number of bond types is %d\n",A.PRM[0].nBT);
00338         if(P[0].S[pa].nt!=A.PRM[0].nBT){mywhine("P[0].S[pa].nt!=A.PRM[0].nBT in BOND_FORCE_CONSTANT in parse_amber_prmtop");}
00339         for(pb=0;pb<A.PRM[0].nBT;pb++){
00340 //printf("P[0].S[%d].D[%d] is >>>%s<<<\n",pa,pb,P[0].S[pa].D[pb]);
00341                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[pb],"%lf",&A.PRM[0].BT[pb].k);
00342                 }
00343 }
00344 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  (REQ(i), i=1,NUMBND)
00345 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"BOND_EQUIL_VALUE")==0){
00346         P[0].REQ    =pa; // REQ    : the equilibrium bond length for the bonds of each type, angstroms 
00347         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00348         if(P[0].S[pa].nt!=A.PRM[0].nBT){mywhine("P[0].S[pa].nt!=A.PRM[0].nBT in BOND_EQUIL_VALUE in parse_amber_prmtop");}
00349         for(pb=0;pb<A.PRM[0].nBT;pb++){sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[pb],"%lf",&A.PRM[0].BT[pb].l);}
00350 }
00351 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  (TK(i), i=1,NUMANG)
00352 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"ANGLE_FORCE_CONSTANT")==0){
00353         P[0].TK     =pa; // TK     : force constant for the angles of each type, kcal/mol A**2 
00354         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00355         if(P[0].S[pa].nt!=A.PRM[0].nANT){mywhine("P[0].S[pa].nt!=A.PRM[0].nANT in ANGLE_FORCE_CONSTANT in parse_amber_prmtop");}
00356         for(pb=0;pb<A.PRM[0].nANT;pb++){sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[pb],"%lf",&A.PRM[0].ANT[pb].k);}
00357 }
00358 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  (TEQ(i), i=1,NUMANG)
00359 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"ANGLE_EQUIL_VALUE")==0){
00360         P[0].TEQ    =pa; // TEQ    : the equilibrium angle for the angles of each type, radians 
00361         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00362         if(P[0].S[pa].nt!=A.PRM[0].nANT){mywhine("P[0].S[pa].nt!=A.PRM[0].nANT in ANGLE_EQUIL_VALUE in parse_amber_prmtop");}
00363         for(pb=0;pb<A.PRM[0].nANT;pb++){sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[pb],"%lf",&A.PRM[0].ANT[pb].l);}
00364 }
00365 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  (PK(i), i=1,NPTRA)
00366 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"DIHEDRAL_FORCE_CONSTANT")==0){
00367         P[0].PK     =pa; // PK     : force constant for the dihedrals of each type, kcal/mol 
00368         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00369         if(P[0].S[pa].nt!=A.PRM[0].nTRT){mywhine("P[0].S[pa].nt!=A.PRM[0].nTRT in DIHEDRAL_FORCE_CONSTANT in parse_amber_prmtop");}
00370         for(pb=0;pb<A.PRM[0].nTRT;pb++){
00371                 if(A.PRM[0].TRT[pb].n>1){mywhine("A.PRM[0].TRT[pb].n>1 in parse_amber_prmtop!");}
00372                 A.PRM[0].TRT[pb].n=1;
00373                 A.PRM[0].TRT[pb].k=(double*)calloc(1,sizeof(double));
00374                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[pb],"%lf",&A.PRM[0].TRT[pb].k[0]);
00375                 }
00376 }
00377 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  (PN(i), i=1,NPTRA)
00378 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"DIHEDRAL_PERIODICITY")==0){
00379         P[0].PN     =pa; // PN     : periodicity of the dihedral of a given type 
00380         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00381         if(P[0].S[pa].nt!=A.PRM[0].nTRT){mywhine("P[0].S[pa].nt!=A.PRM[0].nTRT in DIHEDRAL_PERIODICITY in parse_amber_prmtop");}
00382         for(pb=0;pb<A.PRM[0].nTRT;pb++){
00383                 if(A.PRM[0].TRT[pb].n>1){mywhine("A.PRM[0].TRT[pb].n>1 in parse_amber_prmtop!");}
00384                 A.PRM[0].TRT[pb].n=1;
00385                 A.PRM[0].TRT[pb].N=(double*)calloc(1,sizeof(double));
00386                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[pb],"%lf",&A.PRM[0].TRT[pb].N[0]);
00387                 }
00388 }
00389 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  (PHASE(i), i=1,NPTRA)
00390 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"DIHEDRAL_PHASE")==0){
00391         P[0].PHASE  =pa; // PHASE  : phase of the dihedral of a given type, radians 
00392         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00393         if(P[0].S[pa].nt!=A.PRM[0].nTRT){mywhine("P[0].S[pa].nt!=A.PRM[0].nTRT in DIHEDRAL_PHASE in parse_amber_prmtop");}
00394         for(pb=0;pb<A.PRM[0].nTRT;pb++){
00395                 if(A.PRM[0].TRT[pb].n>1){mywhine("A.PRM[0].TRT[pb].n>1 in parse_amber_prmtop!");}
00396                 A.PRM[0].TRT[pb].n=1;
00397                 A.PRM[0].TRT[pb].P=(double*)calloc(1,sizeof(double));
00398                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[pb],"%lf",&A.PRM[0].TRT[pb].P[0]);
00399                 }
00400 }
00401 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  (SOLTY(i), i=1,NATYP)
00402 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"SOLTY")==0){ // not much to do here at the moment
00403         P[0].SOLTY  =pa; // SOLTY  : currently unused (reserved for future use) 
00404         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00405 }
00406 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  (CN1(i), i=1,NTYPES*(NTYPES+1)/2)
00407 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"LENNARD_JONES_ACOEF")==0){
00408         P[0].CN1    =pa; // CN1    : Lennard Jones r**12 terms for all possible atom type
00409         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00410         if(P[0].S[pa].nt!=A.PRM[0].nNBT){
00411                 fprintf(stdout,"P[0].S[pa].nt (%d) !=A.PRM[0].nNBT (%d) in LENNARD_JONES_ACOEF in parse_amber_prmtop\n",P[0].S[pa].nt,A.PRM[0].nNBT);
00412                 //mywhine("P[0].S[pa].nt!=A.PRM[0].nNBT in LENNARD_JONES_ACOEF in parse_amber_prmtop");
00413                 } 
00414         // record the LJ parameters to the bond type info
00415         for(pb=0;pb<A.PRM[0].nNBT;pb++){ sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[pb],"%lf",&A.PRM[0].NBT[pb].LJ12_612); }
00416                 // interactions, indexed by ICO and IAC; for atom i and j
00417                 // where i < j, the index into this array is as follows
00418                 // (assuming the value of ICO(index) is positive):
00419                 // CN1(ICO(NTYPES*(IAC(i)-1)+IAC(j))).  
00420 }
00421 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  (CN2(i), i=1,NTYPES*(NTYPES+1)/2)
00422 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"LENNARD_JONES_BCOEF")==0){
00423         P[0].CN2    =pa; // CN2    : Lennard Jones r**6 terms for all possible atom type
00424         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00425         if(P[0].S[pa].nt!=A.PRM[0].nNBT){
00426                 fprintf(stdout,"P[0].S[pa].nt (%d) !=A.PRM[0].nNBT (%d) in LENNARD_JONES_BCOEF in parse_amber_prmtop\n",P[0].S[pa].nt,A.PRM[0].nNBT);
00427                 //mywhine("P[0].S[pa].nt!=A.PRM[0].nNBT in LENNARD_JONES_BCOEF in parse_amber_prmtop");
00428                 }
00429         for(pb=0;pb<A.PRM[0].nNBT;pb++){sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[pb],"%lf",&A.PRM[0].NBT[pb].LJ6_612);}
00430                 // interactions.  Indexed like CN1 above.  
00431 }
00432 /* NOTE: the atom numbers in the following arrays that describe bonds, 
00433         angles, and dihedrals are coordinate array indexes for runtime speed. 
00434         The true atom number equals the absolute value of the number divided by 
00435         three, plus one. In the case of the dihedrals, if the fourth atom is negative, 
00436         this implies that the dihedral is an improper. If the third atom is negative, 
00437         this implies that the end group interations are to be ignored. End group 
00438         interactions are ignored, for example, in dihedrals of various ring systems 
00439         (to prevent double counting of 1-4 interactions) and in multiterm dihedrals.  */
00440 // FORMAT(12I6)  (IBH(i),JBH(i),ICBH(i), i=1,NBONH)
00441 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"BONDS_INC_HYDROGEN")==0){
00442         P[0].IBH    =pa; // IBH    : atom involved in bond "i", bond contains hydrogen
00443         P[0].JBH    =pa; // JBH    : atom involved in bond "i", bond contains hydrogen
00444         P[0].ICBH   =pa; // ICBH   : index into parameter arrays RK and REQ 
00445         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00446         if(P[0].S[pa].nt!=3*P[0].NBONH){mywhine("P[0].S[pa].nt!=P[0].NBONH in BONDS_INC_HYDROGEN in parse_amber_prmtop");}
00447         for(pb=0;pb<P[0].NBONH;pb++){
00448                 // read in the values from the section structure
00449                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[3*pb],"%d",&pA1);
00450                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[3*pb+1],"%d",&pA2);
00451                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[3*pb+2],"%d",&pI1); 
00452 //printf("pA1 is %d ; pA2 is %d ; pI1 is %d \n",pA1,pA2,pI1);
00453                 // find the actual atom numbers
00454                 pA1/=3;  // CAREFUL !! these can be negative
00455                 pA2/=3; 
00456                 // set the bond info for these two atoms
00457                 // -- at this point, everything is in the same molecule, so the molecule index
00458                 //      will be set to -1 (to prevent confusion later).
00459                 //      Also, since we don't know the ordering in the file, most info will not be set
00460                 MB[pb].i=pI1; // holder for the index into the RK & REQ arrays
00461                 MB[pb].D=strdup("BONDS_INC_HYDROGEN");
00462                 MB[pb].s.m=-1; // we don't know the molecule number yet
00463                 MB[pb].s.r=-1; // we can't assume we know the residue number yet
00464                 MB[pb].s.a=pA1; // 
00465                 MB[pb].s.i=pA1; // 
00466                 MB[pb].t.m=-1; 
00467                 MB[pb].t.r=-1; 
00468                 MB[pb].t.i=pA2; 
00469                 MB[pb].t.a=pA2; 
00470 //printf("MB[pb].s.i is  %d ; MB[pb].t.i is %d ;  MB[%d].i is %d \n",MB[pb].s.i,MB[pb].t.i,pb,MB[pb].i);
00471                 }
00472 }
00473 // FORMAT(12I6)  (IB(i),JB(i),ICB(i), i=1,NBONA)
00474 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"BONDS_WITHOUT_HYDROGEN")==0){
00475         P[0].IB     =pa; // IB     : atom involved in bond "i", bond does not contain hydrogen
00476         P[0].JB     =pa; // JB     : atom involved in bond "i", bond does not contain hydrogen
00477         P[0].ICB    =pa; // ICB    : index into parameter arrays RK and REQ 
00478         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00479 //printf("NBONH is %d ; MBONA is %d ; (sum : %d) and nb is A.nb=%d \n", P[0].NBONH,P[0].MBONA,P[0].MBONA+P[0].NBONH,A.nb);
00480         //for(pb=P[0].NBONH;pb<(P[0].NBONH+P[0].MBONA);pb++) // save this line for use later...
00481         if(P[0].S[pa].nt!=3*P[0].MBONA){mywhine("P[0].S[pa].nt!=P[0].MBONA in BONDS_WITHOUT_HYDROGEN in parse_amber_prmtop");}
00482         for(pb=0;pb<P[0].MBONA;pb++){ // save this line for use later...
00483 //printf("P[0].S[%d].D[%d] is >>>%s<<<\n",pa,3*pb,P[0].S[pa].D[3*pb]);
00484 //printf("P[0].S[%d].D[%d] is >>>%s<<<\n",pa,3*pb+1,P[0].S[pa].D[3*pb+1]);
00485 //printf("P[0].S[%d].D[%d] is >>>%s<<<\n",pa,3*pb+2,P[0].S[pa].D[3*pb+2]);
00486                 // read in the values from the section structure
00487                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[3*pb],"%d",&pA1);
00488                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[3*pb+1],"%d",&pA2);
00489                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[3*pb+2],"%d",&pI1); 
00490 //printf("(non-H) pA1 is %d ; pA2 is %d ; pI1 is %d \n",pA1,pA2,pI1);
00491                 // find the actual atom numbers
00492                 if(pA1<0) pA1*=-1;
00493                 if(pA2<0) pA2*=-1;
00494                 pA1/=3; // CAREFUL !! these can be negative
00495                 pA2/=3; 
00496                 // set the bond info for these two atoms
00497                 // -- at this point, everything is in the same molecule, so the molecule index
00498                 //      will be set to -1 (to prevent confusion later).
00499                 //      Also, since we don't know the ordering in the file, most info will not be set
00500                 MB[pb+P[0].NBONH].i=pI1; // holder for the index into the RK & REQ arrays
00501                 MB[pb+P[0].NBONH].D=strdup("BONDS_WITHOUT_HYDROGEN");
00502                 MB[pb+P[0].NBONH].s.m=-1; // we don't know the molecule number yet
00503                 MB[pb+P[0].NBONH].s.r=-1; // we can't assume we know the residue number yet
00504                 MB[pb+P[0].NBONH].s.a=pA1; // the best atom number we have at the moment
00505                 MB[pb+P[0].NBONH].s.i=pA1; // for assigning molecules based on bonds, later
00506                 MB[pb+P[0].NBONH].t.m=-1; 
00507                 MB[pb+P[0].NBONH].t.r=-1; 
00508                 MB[pb+P[0].NBONH].t.a=pA2; 
00509                 MB[pb+P[0].NBONH].t.i=pA2; 
00510 //printf("(non-H) MB[pb].s.i is  %d ; MB[pb].t.i is %d ;  MB[%d].i is %d \n",MB[pb+P[0].NBONH].s.i,MB[pb+P[0].NBONH].t.i,pb+P[0].NBONH,MB[pb+P[0].NBONH].i);
00511                 }
00512 }
00513 // FORMAT(12I6)  (ITH(i),JTH(i),KTH(i),ICTH(i), i=1,NTHETH)
00514 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"ANGLES_INC_HYDROGEN")==0){
00515         P[0].ITH    =pa; // ITH    : atom involved in angle "i", angle contains hydrogen
00516         P[0].JTH    =pa; // JTH    : atom involved in angle "i", angle contains hydrogen
00517         P[0].KTH    =pa; // KTH    : atom involved in angle "i", angle contains hydrogen
00518         P[0].ICTH   =pa; // ICTH   : index into parameter arrays TK and TEQ for angle
00519         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00520         if(P[0].S[pa].nt!=4*P[0].NTHETH){mywhine("P[0].S[pa].nt!=P[0].NTHETH in ANGLES_INC_HYDROGEN in parse_amber_prmtop");}
00521         for(pb=0;pb<P[0].NTHETH;pb++){ // angles with hydrogen
00522                 // read in the values from the section structure
00523                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[4*pb],"%d",&pA1);
00524                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[4*pb+1],"%d",&pA2);
00525                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[4*pb+2],"%d",&pA3);
00526                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[4*pb+3],"%d",&pI1); 
00527                 // find the actual atom numbers
00528                 pA1/=3; // CAREFUL !! these can be negative
00529                 pA2/=3; 
00530                 pA3/=3; 
00531                 // set the bond info for these two atoms
00532                 // -- at this point, everything is in the same molecule, so the molecule index
00533                 //      will be set to -1 (to prevent confusion later).
00534                 //      Also, since we don't know the ordering in the file, most info will not be set
00535                 MANG[pb].i=pI1; // holder for the index into the RK & REQ arrays
00536                 MANG[pb].D=strdup("ANGLES_INC_HYDROGEN");
00537                 MANG[pb].a.m=-1; // we don't know the molecule number yet
00538                 MANG[pb].a.r=-1; // we can't assume we know the residue number yet
00539                 MANG[pb].a.a=pA1; // we can't assume the atoms are already read in
00540                 MANG[pb].b.m=-1; 
00541                 MANG[pb].b.r=-1;
00542                 MANG[pb].b.a=pA2; 
00543                 MANG[pb].c.m=-1; 
00544                 MANG[pb].c.r=-1; 
00545                 MANG[pb].c.a=pA3; 
00546                 }
00547 }
00548                 // ITH(i)-JTH(i)-KTH(i) 
00549 // FORMAT(12I6)  (IT(i),JT(i),KT(i),ICT(i), i=1,NTHETA)
00550 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"ANGLES_WITHOUT_HYDROGEN")==0){
00551         P[0].IT     =pa; // IT     : atom involved in angle "i", angle does not contain hydrogen
00552         P[0].JT     =pa; // JT     : atom involved in angle "i", angle does not contain hydrogen
00553         P[0].KT     =pa; // KT     : atom involved in angle "i", angle does not contain hydrogen
00554         P[0].ICT    =pa; // ICT    : index into parameter arrays TK and TEQ for angle
00555         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00556         if(P[0].S[pa].nt!=4*P[0].MTHETA){mywhine("P[0].S[pa].nt!=P[0].MTHETA in ANGLES_WITHOUT_HYDROGEN in parse_amber_prmtop");}
00557         for(pb=0;pb<P[0].MTHETA;pb++){ // angles without hydrogen
00558                 // read in the values from the section structure
00559                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[4*pb],"%d",&pA1);
00560                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[4*pb+1],"%d",&pA2);
00561                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[4*pb+2],"%d",&pA3);
00562                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[4*pb+3],"%d",&pI1); 
00563                 // find the actual atom numbers
00564                 pA1/=3; // CAREFUL !! these can be negative
00565                 pA2/=3; 
00566                 pA3/=3; 
00567                 // set the bond info for these two atoms
00568                 // -- at this point, everything is in the same molecule, so the molecule index
00569                 //      will be set to -1 (to prevent confusion later).
00570                 //      Also, since we don't know the ordering in the file, most info will not be set
00571                 MANG[pb+P[0].NTHETH].i=pI1; // holder for the index into the RK & REQ arrays
00572                 MANG[pb+P[0].NTHETH].D=strdup("ANGLES_WITHOUT_HYDROGEN");
00573                 MANG[pb+P[0].NTHETH].a.m=-1; // we don't know the molecule number yet
00574                 MANG[pb+P[0].NTHETH].a.r=-1; // we can't assume we know the residue number yet
00575                 MANG[pb+P[0].NTHETH].a.a=pA1; // we can't assume the atoms are read in already
00576                 MANG[pb+P[0].NTHETH].b.m=-1; 
00577                 MANG[pb+P[0].NTHETH].b.r=-1; 
00578                 MANG[pb+P[0].NTHETH].b.a=pA2; 
00579                 MANG[pb+P[0].NTHETH].c.m=-1; 
00580                 MANG[pb+P[0].NTHETH].c.r=-1; 
00581                 MANG[pb+P[0].NTHETH].c.a=pA3; 
00582                 }
00583 }
00584                 // IT(i)-JT(i)-KT(i) 
00585 // FORMAT(12I6)  (IPH(i),JPH(i),KPH(i),LPH(i),ICPH(i), i=1,NPHIH)
00586 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"DIHEDRALS_INC_HYDROGEN")==0){
00587         P[0].IPH    =pa; // IPH    : atom involved in dihedral "i", dihedral contains hydrogen
00588         P[0].JPH    =pa; // JPH    : atom involved in dihedral "i", dihedral contains hydrogen
00589         P[0].KPH    =pa; // KPH    : atom involved in dihedral "i", dihedral contains hydrogen
00590         P[0].LPH    =pa; // LPH    : atom involved in dihedral "i", dihedral contains hydrogen
00591         P[0].ICPH   =pa; // ICPH   : index into parameter arrays PK, PN, and PHASE for
00592         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00593         if(P[0].S[pa].nt!=5*P[0].NPHIH){mywhine("P[0].S[pa].nt!=P[0].NPHIH in DIHEDRALS_INC_HYDROGEN in parse_amber_prmtop");}
00594         for(pb=0;pb<P[0].NPHIH;pb++){ // dihedrals with hydrogen
00595                 // read in the values from the section structure
00596                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[5*pb],"%d",&pA1);
00597                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[5*pb+1],"%d",&pA2);
00598                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[5*pb+2],"%d",&pA3);
00599                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[5*pb+3],"%d",&pA3);
00600                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[5*pb+4],"%d",&pI1); 
00601                 // find the actual atom numbers
00602                 pA1/=3; // CAREFUL !! these can be negative
00603                 pA2/=3; 
00604                 pA3/=3; 
00605                 pA4/=3; 
00606                 // set the bond info for these two atoms
00607                 // -- at this point, everything is in the same molecule, so the molecule index
00608                 //      will be set to -1 (to prevent confusion later).
00609                 //      Also, since we don't know the ordering in the file, most info will not be set
00610                 MTOR[pb].i=pI1; // holder for the index into the RK & REQ arrays
00611                 MTOR[pb].D=strdup("DIHEDRALS_INC_HYDROGEN");
00612                 MTOR[pb].a.m=-1; // we don't know the molecule number yet
00613                 MTOR[pb].a.r=-1; // we can't assume we know the residue number yet
00614                 MTOR[pb].a.a=pA1; // we can't assume the atoms are read in already
00615                 MTOR[pb].b.m=-1; 
00616                 MTOR[pb].b.r=-1; 
00617                 MTOR[pb].b.a=pA2; 
00618                 MTOR[pb].c.m=-1; 
00619                 MTOR[pb].c.r=-1; 
00620                 MTOR[pb].c.a=pA3; 
00621                 MTOR[pb].d.m=-1; 
00622                 MTOR[pb].d.r=-1; 
00623                 MTOR[pb].d.a=pA4; 
00624                 }
00625 }
00626                 // dihedral IPH(i)-JPH(i)-KPH(i)-LPH(i) 
00627 // FORMAT(12I6)  (IP(i),JP(i),KP(i),LP(i),ICP(i), i=1,NPHIA)
00628 
00629 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"DIHEDRALS_WITHOUT_HYDROGEN")==0){
00630         P[0].IP     =pa; // IP     : atom involved in dihedral "i", dihedral does not contain hydrogen
00631         P[0].JP     =pa; // JP     : atom involved in dihedral "i", dihedral does not contain hydrogen
00632         P[0].KP     =pa; // KP     : atom involved in dihedral "i", dihedral does not contain hydrogen
00633         P[0].LP     =pa; // LP     : atom involved in dihedral "i", dihedral does not contain hydrogen
00634         P[0].ICP    =pa; // ICP    : index into parameter arrays PK, PN, and PHASE for
00635         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00636         if(P[0].S[pa].nt!=5*P[0].MPHIA){mywhine("P[0].S[pa].nt!=P[0].MPHIA in DIHEDRALS_WITHOUT_HYDROGEN in parse_amber_prmtop");}
00637         for(pb=0;pb<P[0].MPHIA;pb++){ // dihedrals with hydrogen
00638                 // read in the values from the section structure
00639                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[5*pb],"%d",&pA1);
00640                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[5*pb+1],"%d",&pA2);
00641                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[5*pb+2],"%d",&pA3);
00642                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[5*pb+3],"%d",&pA3);
00643                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[5*pb+4],"%d",&pI1); 
00644                 // find the actual atom numbers
00645                 pA1/=3; // CAREFUL !! these can be negative
00646                 pA2/=3; 
00647                 pA3/=3; 
00648                 pA4/=3; 
00649                 // set the bond info for these two atoms
00650                 // -- at this point, everything is in the same molecule, so the molecule index
00651                 //      will be set to -1 (to prevent confusion later).
00652                 //      Also, since we don't know the ordering in the file, most info will not be set
00653                 MTOR[pb+P[0].NPHIH].i=pI1; // holder for the index into the RK & REQ arrays
00654                 MTOR[pb+P[0].NPHIH].D=strdup("DIHEDRALS_INC_HYDROGEN");
00655                 MTOR[pb+P[0].NPHIH].a.m=-1; // we don't know the molecule number yet
00656                 MTOR[pb+P[0].NPHIH].a.r=-1; // we can't assume we know the residue number yet
00657                 MTOR[pb+P[0].NPHIH].a.a=pA1; // we can't assume the atoms are read in already
00658                 MTOR[pb+P[0].NPHIH].b.m=-1; 
00659                 MTOR[pb+P[0].NPHIH].b.r=-1; 
00660                 MTOR[pb+P[0].NPHIH].b.a=pA2; 
00661                 MTOR[pb+P[0].NPHIH].c.m=-1; 
00662                 MTOR[pb+P[0].NPHIH].c.r=-1; 
00663                 MTOR[pb+P[0].NPHIH].c.a=pA3; 
00664                 MTOR[pb+P[0].NPHIH].d.m=-1; 
00665                 MTOR[pb+P[0].NPHIH].d.r=-1; 
00666                 MTOR[pb+P[0].NPHIH].d.a=pA4; 
00667                 }
00668 }
00669 
00670                 // dihedral IPH(i)-JPH(i)-KPH(i)-LPH(i).  Note, if the
00671                 // periodicity is negative, this implies the following entry
00672                 // in the PK, PN, and PHASE arrays is another term in a
00673                 // multitermed dihedral.  
00674 // FORMAT(12I6)  (NATEX(i), i=1,NEXT)
00675 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"EXCLUDED_ATOMS_LIST")==0){
00676         P[0].NATEX  =pa; // NATEX  : the excluded atom list.  To get the excluded list for atom 
00677         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00678 }
00679                 // "i" you need to traverse the NUMEX list, adding up all
00680                 // the previous NUMEX values, since NUMEX(i) holds the number
00681                 // of excluded atoms for atom "i", not the index into the 
00682                 // NATEX list.  Let IEXCL = SUM(NUMEX(j), j=1,i-1), then
00683                 // excluded atoms are NATEX(IEXCL) to NATEX(IEXCL+NUMEX(i)).  
00684 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  (ASOL(i), i=1,NPHB)
00685 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"HBOND_ACOEF")==0){
00686         P[0].ASOL   =pa; // ASOL   : the value for the r**12 term for hydrogen bonds of all
00687         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00688 //printf("A.PRM[0].nNBT is %d\n",A.PRM[0].nNBT);
00689         if(P[0].NPHB>0){
00690         if(P[0].S[pa].nt>0){
00691         for(pb=0;pb<P[0].S[pa].nt;pb++){sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[pb],"%lf",&A.PRM[0].NBT[pb].LJ12_1012);}
00692         //for(pb=0;pb<A.PRM[0].nNBT;pb++){sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[pb],"%lf",&A.PRM[0].NBT[pb].LJ12_1012);}
00693                 }
00694                 }
00695 }
00696                 // possible types.  Index into these arrays is equivalent
00697                 // to the CN1 and CN2 arrays, however the index is negative.
00698                 // For example, for atoms i and j, with i < j, the index is
00699                 // ICO(NTYPES*(IAC(i)-1+IAC(j)).  
00700 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  (BSOL(i), i=1,NPHB)
00701 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"HBOND_BCOEF")==0){
00702         P[0].BSOL   =pa; // BSOL   : the value for the r**10 term for hydrogen bonds of all
00703         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00704         if(P[0].NPHB>0){
00705         if(P[0].S[pa].nt>0){
00706                 for(pb=0;pb<P[0].S[pa].nt;pb++){sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[pb],"%lf",&A.PRM[0].NBT[pb].LJ10_1012);}
00707                 //for(pb=0;pb<A.PRM[0].nNBT;pb++){sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[pb],"%lf",&A.PRM[0].NBT[pb].LJ10_1012);}
00708                 }
00709                 }
00710 }
00711                 // possible types.  Indexed like ASOL.  
00712 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  (HBCUT(i), i=1,NPHB)
00713 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"HBCUT")==0){
00714         P[0].HBCUT  =pa; // HBCUT  : no longer in use 
00715         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00716 }
00717 // FORMAT(20A4)  (ISYMBL(i), i=1,NATOM)
00718 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"AMBER_ATOM_TYPE")==0){
00719         P[0].ISYMBL =pa; // ISYMBL : the AMBER atom types for each atom 
00720         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00721         // Can't assume we've already read in the type numbers...
00722         // read one per each atom, just like it is in the file
00723         if(P[0].S[pa].nt!=A.na){mywhine("P[0].S[pa].nt!=A.na in AMBER_ATOM_TYPE in parse_amber_prmtop");}
00724         ATNAME=(char**)calloc(A.na,sizeof(char*));
00725         for(pb=0;pb<A.na;pb++){
00726                 ATNAME[pb]=(char*)calloc(P[0].S[pa].nc+1,sizeof(char));
00727                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[pb],"%s",ATNAME[pb]);
00728                 }
00729 }
00730 // FORMAT(20A4)  (ITREE(i), i=1,NATOM)
00731 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"TREE_CHAIN_CLASSIFICATION")==0){
00732         P[0].ITREE  =pa; // ITREE  : the list of tree joining information, classified into five
00733         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00734         if(P[0].S[pa].nt!=A.na){mywhine("P[0].S[pa].nt!=A.na in TREE_CHAIN_CLASSIFICATION in parse_amber_prmtop");}
00735         TREECLASS=(char**)calloc(A.na,sizeof(char*));
00736         for(pb=0;pb<A.na;pb++){
00737                 TREECLASS[pb]=(char*)calloc(P[0].S[pa].nc+1,sizeof(char));
00738                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[pb],"%s",TREECLASS[pb]);
00739                 }
00740 }
00741                 // types.  M -- main chain, S -- side chain, B -- branch point, 
00742                 // 3 -- branch into three chains, E -- end of the chain 
00743 // FORMAT(12I6)  (JOIN(i), i=1,NATOM)
00744 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"JOIN_ARRAY")==0){
00745         P[0].JOIN   =pa; // JOIN   : tree joining information, potentially used in ancient
00746                 // analysis programs.  Currently unused in sander or gibbs.  
00747         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00748 }
00749 // FORMAT(12I6)  (IROTAT(i), i = 1, NATOM)
00750 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"IROTAT")==0){
00751         P[0].IROTAT =pa; // IROTAT : apparently the last atom that would move if atom i was
00752                 // rotated, however the meaning has been lost over time.
00753                 // Currently unused in sander or gibbs.
00754         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00755 }
00756 // FORMAT(12I6)  IPTRES, NSPM, NSPSOL
00757 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"SOLVENT_POINTERS")==0){
00758         P[0].IPTRES =pa; // IPTRES : final residue that is considered part of the solute,
00759                 // reset in sander and gibbs
00760         P[0].NSPM   =pa; // NSPM   : total number of molecules
00761         P[0].NSPSOL =pa; // NSPSOL : the first solvent "molecule" 
00762         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00763         if(P[0].S[pa].nt==3){
00764                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[0],"%d",&IPTRES);
00765                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[1],"%d",&NSPM);
00766                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[2],"%d",&NSPSOL);
00767                 }
00768 }
00769 // FORMAT(12I6)  (NSP(i), i=1,NSPM)
00770 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"ATOMS_PER_MOLECULE")==0){
00771         P[0].NSP    =pa; // NSP    : the total number of atoms in each molecule,
00772                 // necessary to correctly perform the pressure scaling.  
00773         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00774         NSP=(int*)calloc(P[0].S[pa].nt,sizeof(int));
00775         for(pb=0;pb<P[0].S[pa].nt;pb++){sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[pb],"%d",&NSP[pb]);}
00776 }
00777 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  BETA, BOX(1), BOX(2), BOX(3)
00778 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"BOX_DIMENSIONS")==0){
00779         P[0].BETA   =pa; // BETA   : periodic box, angle between the XY and YZ planes in degrees.
00780         P[0].BOX    =pa; // BOX    : the periodic box lengths in the X, Y, and Z directions 
00781         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00782         if(P[0].S[pa].nt==4){
00783                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[0],"%lf",&A.BOX[0].C[0].D[0]); 
00784                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[1],"%lf",&A.BOX[0].C[1].D[0]); 
00785                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[2],"%lf",&A.BOX[0].C[1].D[1]); 
00786                 sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[3],"%lf",&A.BOX[0].C[1].D[2]); 
00787                 //sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[0],"%lf",&A.boxang); // changed for new box_info by BLF on 20080813
00788                 //sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[1],"%lf",&A.boxl.i);
00789                 //sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[2],"%lf",&A.boxl.j);
00790                 //sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[3],"%lf",&A.boxl.k);
00791                 }
00792         else{fprintf(stderr,"\nIn parse_amber_prmtop.c : unexpected number of entries in section BOX_DIMENSIONS.  Ignoring contents.\n\n");}
00793 }
00794 // The following are only present if IFCAP .gt. 0 
00795 // FORMAT(12I6)  NATCAP
00796 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"CAP_INFO")==0){
00797         P[0].NATCAP =pa; // NATCAP : last atom before the start of the cap of waters placed by edit 
00798         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00799 }
00800 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  CUTCAP, XCAP, YCAP, ZCAP
00801 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"CAP_INFO2")==0){ // not putting this in quite yet
00802         P[0].CUTCAP =pa; // CUTCAP : the distance from the center of the cap to the outside
00803         P[0].XCAP   =pa; // XCAP   : X coordinate for the center of the cap
00804         P[0].YCAP   =pa; // YCAP   : Y coordinate for the center of the cap
00805         P[0].ZCAP   =pa; // ZCAP   : Z coordinate for the center of the cap 
00806         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00807 }
00808 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"RADIUS_SET")==0){
00809         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00810         if(P[0].S[pa].nt>0){RADTYPE=strdup(P[0].S[pa].D[0]);}
00811 }
00812 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"RADII")==0){
00813         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00814         if(P[0].S[pa].nt!=A.na){mywhine("P[0].S[pa].nt!=A.na in RADII in parse_amber_prmtop.");}
00815         R=(double*)calloc(A.na,sizeof(double));
00816         for(pb=0;pb<A.na;pb++){sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[pb],"%lf",&R[pb]);}
00817 }
00818 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"SCREEN")==0){
00819         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00820         if(P[0].S[pa].nt!=A.na){mywhine("P[0].S[pa].nt!=A.na in SCREEN in parse_amber_prmtop.");}
00821         SC=(double*)calloc(A.na,sizeof(double));
00822         for(pb=0;pb<A.na;pb++){sscanf(P[0].S[pa].D[pb],"%lf",&SC[pb]);}
00823 }
00824 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"LES_NTYP")==0){ // leave these out for now
00825         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00826 }
00827 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"LES_TYPE")==0){
00828         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00829 }
00830 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"LES_FAC")==0){
00831         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00832 }
00833 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"LES_CNUM")==0){
00834         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00835 }
00836 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"LES_ID")==0){
00837         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00838 }
00839 // The following is only present if IFPERT .gt. 0
00840 /* Note that the initial state, or equivalently the prep/link/edit state, 
00841         is represented by lambda=1 and the perturbed state, or final state 
00842         specified in parm, is the lambda=0 state. */ 
00843 // FORMAT(12I6)  (IBPER(i), JBPER(i), i=1,NBPER)
00844 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"PERT_BOND_ATOMS")==0){
00845 // The following are only present if IFBOX .gt. 0 
00846         P[0].IBPER  =pa; // IBPER  : atoms involved in perturbed bonds
00847         P[0].JBPER  =pa; // JBPER  : atoms involved in perturbed bonds 
00848         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00849 }
00850 // FORMAT(12I6)  (ICBPER(i), i=1,2*NBPER)
00851 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"PERT_BOND_PARAMS")==0){
00852         P[0].ICBPER =pa; // ICBPER : pointer into the bond parameter arrays RK and REQ for the
00853         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00854 }
00855                 // perturbed bonds.  ICBPER(i) represents lambda=1 and 
00856                 // ICBPER(i+NBPER) represents lambda=0.  
00857 // FORMAT(12I6)  (ITPER(i), JTPER(i), KTPER(i), i=1,NGPER)
00858 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"PERT_ANGLE_ATOMS")==0){
00859         P[0].IPTER  =pa; // IPTER  : atoms involved in perturbed angles
00860         P[0].JTPER  =pa; // JTPER  : atoms involved in perturbed angles
00861         P[0].KTPER  =pa; // KTPER  : atoms involved in perturbed angles 
00862         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00863 }
00864 // FORMAT(12I6)  (ICTPER(i), i=1,2*NGPER)
00865 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"PERT_ANGLE_PARAMS")==0){
00866         P[0].ICTPER =pa; // ICTPER : pointer into the angle parameter arrays TK and TEQ for 
00867         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00868 }
00869                 // the perturbed angles.  ICTPER(i) represents lambda=0 and 
00870                 // ICTPER(i+NGPER) represents lambda=1.  
00871 // FORMAT(12I6)  (IPPER(i), JPPER(i), KPPER(i), LPPER(i), i=1,NDPER)
00872 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"PERT_DIHEDRAL_ATOMS")==0){
00873         P[0].IPPER  =pa; // IPPER  : atoms involved in perturbed dihedrals
00874         P[0].JPPER  =pa; // JPPER  : atoms involved in perturbed dihedrals

00877         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00878 }
00879 // FORMAT(12I6)  (ICPPER(i), i=1,2*NDPER)
00880 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"PERT_DIHEDRAL_PARAMS")==0){
00881         P[0].ICPPER =pa; // ICPPER : pointer into the dihedral parameter arrays PK, PN and
00882         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00883 }
00884                 // PHASE for the perturbed dihedrals.  ICPPER(i) represents 
00885                 // lambda=1 and ICPPER(i+NGPER) represents lambda=0.  
00886 // FORMAT(20A4)  (LABRES(i), i=1,NRES)
00887 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"PERT_RESIDUE_NAME")==0){
00888         P[0].LABRES =pa; // LABRES : residue names at lambda=0 
00889         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00890 }
00891 // FORMAT(20A4)  (IGRPER(i), i=1,NATOM)
00892 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"PERT_ATOM_NAME")==0){
00893         P[0].IGRPER =pa; // IGRPER : atomic names at lambda=0 
00894         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00895 }
00896 // FORMAT(20A4)  (ISMPER(i), i=1,NATOM)
00897 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"PERT_ATOM_SYMBOL")==0){
00898         P[0].ISMPER =pa; // ISMPER : atomic symbols at lambda=0 
00899         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00900 }
00901 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  (ALMPER(i), i=1,NATOM)
00902 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"ALMPER")==0){
00903         P[0].ALMPER =pa; // ALMPER : unused currently in gibbs 
00904         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00905 }
00906 // FORMAT(12I6)  (IAPER(i), i=1,NATOM)
00907 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"IAPER")==0){
00908         P[0].IAPER  =pa; // IAPER  : IAPER(i) = 1 if the atom is being perturbed 
00909         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00910 }
00911 // FORMAT(12I6)  (IACPER(i), i=1,NATOM)
00912 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"PERT_ATOM_TYPE_INDEX")==0){
00913         P[0].IACPER =pa; // IACPER : index for the atom types involved in Lennard Jones
00914         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00915 }
00916                 // interactions at lambda=0.  Similar to IAC above.  See ICO above.  
00917 // FORMAT(5E16.8)  (CGPER(i), i=1,NATOM)
00918 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"PERT_CHARGE")==0){
00919         P[0].CGPER  =pa; // CGPER  : atomic charges at lambda=0 
00920         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00921 }
00922 // The following is only present if IPOL .eq. 1 
00923 // FORMAT(5E18.8) (ATPOL(i), i=1,NATOM)
00924 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"POLARIZABILITY")==0){ // leave out for now
00925         P[0].ATPOL  =pa; // ATPOL  : atomic polarizabilities 
00926         P[0].S[pa].is_standard=0; // set as a standard section
00927 }
00928 // The following is only present if IPOL .eq. 1 .and. IFPERT .eq. 1 
00929 // FORMAT(5E18.8) (ATPOL1(i), i=1,NATOM)
00930 if(strcmp(P[0].S[pa].N,"PERT_POLARIZABILITY")==0){

00933 }
00934         } // close loop through each section in the prmtop structure

00955 for(pa=0;pa<A.na;pa++){ A.PRM[0].AT[A.a[pa][0].t].N=strdup(ATNAME[pa]); }

00958 //int *ICO,nICO;

00960 // For example, for atoms i and j, with i < j, the index is
00961 // ICO(NTYPES*(IAC(i)-1)+IAC(j)).  
00962 pI1=P[0].NTYPES*(P[0].NTYPES+1)/2;
00963 for(pa=0;pa<A.PRM[0].nAT;pa++){ // this is index 'j' in the prmtop file
00964 for(pb=0;pb<(pa+1);pb++){ // this is index 'i' in the prmtop file

00972         }

00988 // Rearrange the structures to reflect the new molecule information
00989 // 1. Find numbers of molecules and make space
00990 //      The molecules, coming from find_molecules_molbond_array, should count 
00991 //      sequentially starting with zero.

00993 nummol=0;

01001         }

01018         //free(A.r[pa]); // free space

01023                 MOLBNDI[A.r[pa][0].a[pb].n-1].r=A.m[resi[pa]][0].nr-1;

01096         // set both atoms as being bonded to the other
01097         A.m[sm][0].r[sr].a[sa].mb[A.m[sm][0].r[sr].a[sa].nmb-1]=A.b[pa]; // if already "source", all is ok
01098         // if the atom is a "target", we have to turn things around a bit
01099         A.m[tm][0].r[tr].a[ta].mb[A.m[tm][0].r[tr].a[ta].nmb-1].s.a = A.b[pa].t.a;

01102         A.m[tm][0].r[tr].a[ta].mb[A.m[tm][0].r[tr].a[ta].nmb-1].t.a = A.b[pa].s.a ;
01103         A.m[tm][0].r[tr].a[ta].mb[A.m[tm][0].r[tr].a[ta].nmb-1].t.r = A.b[pa].s.r ;
01104         A.m[tm][0].r[tr].a[ta].mb[A.m[tm][0].r[tr].a[ta].nmb-1].t.m = A.b[pa].s.m ;
